information.name: DevOps Book Haven
information.description: Welcome to DevOps Book Haven, your go-to destination for all things related to development and operations. Explore our vast collection of books covering software development, automation, cloud computing, and more. Whether you're a seasoned engineer or a curious beginner, find the resources you need to thrive in the world of DevOps.

product.title: The DevOps Handbook
product.author: Gene Kim
product.description: The DevOps Handbook has been the definitive guide for taking the successes laid out in the best-selling The Phoenix Project and applying them in any organization. Now, with this fully updated and expanded edition, itâ€™s time to take DevOps out of the IT department and apply it across the full business.

product.title: Learning DevOps
product.author: Mikael Krief
product.description: Implement modern DevOps techniques to increase business productivity, agility, reliability, security, and scalability

product.title: DevOps for the Desperate
product.author: Bradley Smith
product.description: DevOps for the Desperate is a hands-on, no-nonsense guide for those who land in a DevOps environment and need to get up and running quickly.

product.title: Cloud Native DevOps with Kubernetes
product.author: Justin Domingus
product.description: Kubernetes has become the operating system of today's cloud native world, providing a reliable and scalable platform for running containerized workloads. In this friendly, pragmatic book, cloud experts Justin Domingus and John Arundel show you what Kubernetes can do-and what you can do with it.

product.title: The Phoenix Project
product.author: Gene Kim
product.description: The Phoenix Project continues to guide IT in the DevOps revolution.

product.title: DevOps For Dummies
product.author: Emily Freeman
product.description: DevOps embraces a culture of unifying the creation and distribution of technology in a way that allows for faster release cycles and more resource-efficient product updating. DevOps For Dummies provides a guidebook for those on the development or operations side in need of a primer on this way of working.

product.title: Automating DevOps with GitLab CI/CD Pipelines
product.author: Christopher Cowell
product.description: Use GitLab CI/CD pipelines for automating and deploying different steps of your software development lifecycle using best practices and troubleshooting methods.

product.title: Effective DevOps: Building a Culture of Collaboration, Affinity, and Tooling at Scale
product.author: Jennifer Davis
product.description: Devops stresses iterative efforts to break down information silos, monitor relationships, and repair misunderstandings that arise between and within teams in your organization.

product.title: Team Topologies
product.author: Matthew Skelton
product.description: Effective software teams are essential for any organization to deliver value continuously and sustainably. But how do you build the best team organization for your specific goals, culture, and needs?

product.title: Thinking in Systems: A Primer
product.author: Donella H. Meadows
product.description: Thinking in Systems is a concise and crucial book offering insight for problem-solving on scales ranging from the personal to the global.
